articles.headline: Soccer Team Is Found Alive in Thailand Cave Rescue
articles.snippet: The boys and their coach had been trapped for more than a week by rising floodwaters. Evacuating them from the flooded cave complex will be a difficult operation.
articles.abstract: The boys and their coach had been trapped for more than a week by rising floodwaters. Evacuating them from the flooded cave complex will be a difficult operation.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAE SAI, Thailand — The scrawny boys were huddled on the floor of the cave when the British divers emerged from the murky water.
articles.byline: By Muktita Suhartono and Richard C. Paddock

articles.headline: Trump Warns NATO Allies to Spend More on Defense, or Else
articles.snippet: The letters, which went out last month, are the latest sign of acrimony between Mr. Trump and American allies as he heads to a NATO summit meeting next week in Brussels.
articles.abstract: The letters, which went out last month, are the latest sign of acrimony between Mr. Trump and American allies as he heads to a NATO summit meeting next week in Brussels.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has written sharply worded letters to the leaders of several NATO allies — including Germany, Belgium, Norway and Canada — taking them to task for spending too little on their own defense and warning that the United States is losing patience with what he said was their failure to meet security obligations shared by the alliance.

articles.headline: Paris Beckons as a Fare War Turns Europe Into a Bargain
articles.snippet: Growth in the number of low-cost trans-Atlantic flights and a willingness by airlines to undercut rivals have led to cheap tickets to Europe.
articles.abstract: Growth in the number of low-cost trans-Atlantic flights and a willingness by airlines to undercut rivals have led to cheap tickets to Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: Forget Yellowstone. Right now, you can buy a ticket to travel from New York to Paris in August — on a major American airline — for under $500.

articles.headline: An ICE Raid Leaves an Iowa Town Divided Along Faith Lines
articles.snippet: The detention of 32 workers at a concrete plant opened fissures among the town’s churches and secular leaders, and brought an abstract national issue painfully close to home.
articles.abstract: The detention of 32 workers at a concrete plant opened fissures among the town’s churches and secular leaders, and brought an abstract national issue painfully close to home.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOUNT PLEASANT, Iowa — In the days after immigration agents raided a dusty concrete plant on the west side of town, seizing 32 men from Mexico and Central America, the Rev. Trey Hegar, pastor of the First Presbyterian Church, got into an impassioned argument on his Facebook page.

articles.headline: Trump Officials Reverse Obama’s Policy on Affirmative Action in Schools
articles.snippet: The Justice and Education Departments will encourage the nation’s schools and universities to adopt race-blind admissions policies.
articles.abstract: The Justice and Education Departments will encourage the nation’s schools and universities to adopt race-blind admissions policies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration said Tuesday that it was abandoning Obama administration policies that called on universities to consider race as a factor in diversifying their campuses, signaling that the administration will champion race-blind admissions standards.
articles.byline: By Erica L. Green, Matt Apuzzo and Katie Benner
